who avoid singletons because they are evil
(http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?SingletonsAreEvil) can realize some better
performance...

On Thu, 21 Feb 2002, <magnus@...> wrote:

> So my question is, is this a correct understanding of the ant junit
> task,

Basically yes - but you should probably ask that on
ant-user@.... 8-)

> and are there any reasons why it should not run all tests in a
> single process, to increase speed?

fork="true" is not only there to get rid of Ant's classes, but also to
isolate test cases from each other - tests that load native libraries
and fail because a different test has already loaded them, tests that
use Singletons and rely on a certain state and so on.

Many things, the Singleton case above for example, can be solved by
writing tests properly, but this was one additional reason to
implement forking in <junit> as it is.

Stefan
